reviews.text: Great place to visit with the family and/or dog. A historic trail runs through the property. Check for local events such as the Blueberry Festival.

This beautiful plantation takes you back to the 1700's. I worked as a vendor for the Blueberry festival July 21-22, 2018. I took the tour of the historic Burnside house. It has an interesting story. I recommend taking the short tour.
 The ground are gorgeous! I love the huge vegetable garden. The barns, the willow tree border.
My children and I really enjoyed our time$

We came today for Apple Days. It was pretty neat. Lost of great vendors, all apple flavored food varieties, live band. They had a kids tent and petting zoo. The weather was obviously not ideal but that didnt stop people. I definitely recommend this.
A small farm-like establishment, every building was closed when we visited. Nice place to walk around for about 15 minutes. Beautiful trail by a creek nearby.

Loved the colonial era buildings and the restoration they're doing. There are some information boards offering tidbits about the buildings and their significance during the town's heyday. But all of them are locked so you can't see what's inside. The walk paths are well marked and the views are pretty amazing. There should at least be one museum here that presents the history of the town. I hope they're working on it. Half an hour is more than enough to walk the entire area.
Beautiful architecture! Very scenic. Love how they're restoring it back to its former glory and seeing what new things they discover!!
I take my son there to ride his bike without the worry of traffic.
Good place to go for a walk in town. Some buildings in various stages of restoration can be seen here.
Interestingly beautiful. Stream is so peaceful.
There are great walking tours. Our guide was clearly enjoying her job and was very very knowledgeable. Well worth it.
People didn't explain much and rambled about paying something so inaudible from person. .then ssid free to tour for Christmas weekend but need to buy a membership before you can visit free sites
Great experience. Tour wasn't short. Guide was very helpful!
Rich historical location in Bethlehem. Definitely worth spending some time here if you're interested in Moravian history!

How can one describe being immersed in a period of history and a culture that one knew NOTHING about??!!  The personal guide was more than informative; she was personable, too.  She responded to questions with an obviously intelligent knowledge of the subject at hand.  We would recommend this facility to EVERYONE

An old steel mill that is now some sort of an art installation, this place is weirdly beautiful. The giant iron tubes blast furnaces and chimneys give the impression that you are in the presence of an alien space ship. If you are interested in knowing how iron ore changes into steel then you will love this visit. It could also be a history/sociology tour if you'd like to know what it was to work inside one of the most famous steel plants in the US from a hundred years ago. I was impressed.

Great place to walk around. There’s so much rich history here. I’m definitely going to look into it more. So interesting especially for an engineer!  Also a little sad because there’s such a big piece of history here.

This place is surprisingly cool. How did they turn a hunk of ugly rusted twisted metal into a sight to behold? I love the elevated walkway. It looks awesome at night & also provides great views. Also, very clean area with tons of events.
Fun show with good space to dance. Not the best acoustics. The drinks were reasonably priced for this type of venue. I did not try the food.

So it was actually a school field trip we had. It was pretty fun i guess we first had a tour of the museum there. Then we went up the steel stacks to see them. Lastly we went back to the school. I enjoyed it mostly

I would not return here. 
We went on St Patrick’s day, so it was more noisy than I’m guessing it usually is, but my family had to text to each other at the table to hear each other. 
The service was not overly friendly. No personal recommendations or anything. 
The menu was pretty basic and I didn’t feel like I had a lot of choices. However, my dad LOVED the burger. 
The historical nature had its charm. But it’s not worth it if there’s better choices.

Tonight our multi-generational family of 12 celebrated my mother in law and father in laws combined 70th birthdays with a surprise dinner party. The management at the Tavern at the Sun Inn (Dorian) was wonderful in helping me plan the surprise, found us a room at the Tavern which we had all to ourselves, provided us a great server, Patrick, who was knowledgeable, friendly, non-intrusive, and let us enjoy a wonderful dinner together. The food and drinks were were great, the atmosphere calm and pleasant, and the staff helpful and kind. Thank you for a wonderful evening!
Ambience and food are superb!!  Felt like you were truly dining in a colonial tavern!! The restoration is beautiful!!
My wife's tomato soup was very thick and not very flavorful.  Lobster roll was bland.  The burger I had was overcooked but was still moist and tasty

a wonderful dining experience! homemade bread, entrees, dessert, AND drinks were all incredible, not to mention the ambience of the inn itself. absolutely worth a trip to Bethlehem to eat where many of our founding fathers once did.

The two young men on staff tonight,  Dec. 29th, were very pleasant and personable,  but unfortunately the young woman behind the cash register was not friendly at all. I just thought you should know. It would probably be better to have someone more cheerful and upbeat greeting visitors.

Visiting Bethlehem for the Runners World Runners fest. ( not a runner a spouse ) Purchased the "Death and Dying Tour" IT was fabulous due to the Guide Ted he was very knowledgeable and well spoken.  The group was small and moved slowly . We did the 'Ghost Tour' later that night and a poor guide made it almost useless.,

December 29, 2018.  I was about to write a review about the Visting Center how the young gentlemen were so helpful and friendly and the woman was like i was bothering her. But I saw someone beat me to it. We had an amazing time visiting the trees and museums. But honestly people working at the visting center should be helpful and looking to make your staying welcoming. The woman in front of me needed her to get more candles from the black. The sales woman looked annoyed she had to go in the back. I know it’s hard dealing with the public but we were nothing but nice and pleasant there was no reason for her being unpleasant.  Just saying!!
Took an informative walking tour! Greatly enjoyed it. Good value for the $. Nice quaint visitor center/store.

What a delightful evening full of tradition, history and spirited food. So glad I took the time to spend the day in Bethlehem and take advantage of the many delights. Still lingers in my heart and mind one month later!

The two young men on staff tonight,  Dec. 29th, were very pleasant and personable,  but unfortunately the young woman behind the cash register was not friendly at all. I just thought you should know. It would probably be better to have someone more cheerful and upbeat greeting visitors.

Visiting Bethlehem for the Runners World Runners fest. ( not a runner a spouse ) Purchased the "Death and Dying Tour" IT was fabulous due to the Guide Ted he was very knowledgeable and well spoken.  The group was small and moved slowly . We did the 'Ghost Tour' later that night and a poor guide made it almost useless.,

December 29, 2018.  I was about to write a review about the Visting Center how the young gentlemen were so helpful and friendly and the woman was like i was bothering her. But I saw someone beat me to it. We had an amazing time visiting the trees and museums. But honestly people working at the visting center should be helpful and looking to make your staying welcoming. The woman in front of me needed her to get more candles from the black. The sales woman looked annoyed she had to go in the back. I know it’s hard dealing with the public but we were nothing but nice and pleasant there was no reason for her being unpleasant.  Just saying!!
Took an informative walking tour! Greatly enjoyed it. Good value for the $. Nice quaint visitor center/store.

What a delightful evening full of tradition, history and spirited food. So glad I took the time to spend the day in Bethlehem and take advantage of the many delights. Still lingers in my heart and mind one month later!

Nice large casino floor with a lot of games to play and a lot of slot machines. The floor is level and easy to navigate. There is a good court right outside the casino floor and a few places that you can access from the casino. There is a poker room here. There are outlets upstairs and downstairs here as well and kid's quest is where you can check in your children to play while you go to the casino which is nice. The only issue I saw was that there are a lot of people that come over on buses that sleep at the slot machines and when they are not sleeping they are bumping into you or blocking the walkways because they don't pay attention to where they are going.

It was easy to fine and beautiful scenic drive! I gave it ⭐⭐⭐ because people still smoke on non smoking area, being a non smoker I only gamble on non smoking area. And they don't have free soda machine like Horseshoe & Hollywood.

Really large casino with music on the weekends and all you can eat lobster some nights as well. It took me a while to realize those glowing orange “carrots” hanging from the ceiling are drippings of steel. 

Worth a visit, and maybe the highlight of Bethlehem, PA. It certainly was my highlight since I won quite a bit!

Good luck!

I love the Sands, it is clean, staff is polite and very helpful, we were treated with care and even had an upgrade on rooms for my Birthday to Presidents suit, it was sweet. Love the casino we win all the time it is worth going a distant to get there. Great experience.

It was a nice experience! To Smokey for me because I don't smoke but I accompanied a friend and had a nice time! I love the chairs in the high-roller room! If you ever want to sell them I'm down for 2 and if you really want to be generous Take 6! LOL! Nice time!
5 star staff.  Plesent and helpful.  Not the biggest fan of some of the prices, but found some bargains and stocked up.  E-mail deals are great at this store.

Nice clean store, huge and great selection. Was just buying bottle rockets etc for the kids for NYE. A lot of security- the guy at the entrance had a gun!! Everything is kind of expensive, but everything is BOGO- so in the end not too costly, but more than you need.
I liked this fireworks store. They are nice and have a amazing selection of fireworks. This store is way bigger than the Morrisvile store.

Great deals here everything is buy one get one free. Fair prices for what you get. The staff is very helpful and very knowledgeable on their product. You don't have to pretend to know everything when you come in here they don't treat you like an idiot.

Prices are pretty high-1star. They don't sell bricks of jumping jacks...-1 star.
People are nice and helpful :)
I'll be back when they have better promotions :)
Good place to eat
Fantastic breakfast sandwiches, friendly staff

Will never return. Poor service. Served room temp. water with no ice in tiny 4 oz glasses. Waitress never came back to the table once the food was served. I walked to the register to ask for my check. The women told me that she would be right with me. She was never more that three feet away from me. 5 minutes later my wife came to me and ask another women for our check. She was refered back to the women I had ask for the check. I stood there for a total of 12 minutes before I received the check. Nobody else, at any time, was at the register to pay their bill. 
We were just ignored for the 12 minute period. 

I have never written a bad review in my life. Does this in itself tell you how bad it was since I had poor service at other places and have not written one word about it?

Local mom and pops Ukrainian/Russian deli. Let me tell you..this place is outstanding. The food is prepared as if you are a guest in their home. Places like this are becoming very rare. Absolutely delicious. The people are very nice. Everything is fresh made. Been here multiple times. I highly recommend. Only tough part is there hrs.

Exceptional !  I have heard about the Black Forest Deli and always wanted to stop in.  I was in the neighborhood and so glad I stopped in. Best chicken salad/avocado sandwich & blintzes for a light desert.  Had my food to go but the cafe looked so homey and welcoming that next time I will eat in.  Highly recommend !

Great menu options , Russian / Ukrainian food.  Sandwiches, soups, platters, perogies,  etc. The food is impressively prepared but from my point of view there I saw the people  microwave the soup and the schnitzel platter. Microwaves are lazy cooking and I feel that no-one should be charge for nuked food.  Home made or fast food ,  it's lazy.  I ate perogies and have had a sandwich there. Good but i distrust the platters. In my. Opinion, Microwaved food platters  equals
 leftovers.... nutritionally devoid and with compromised texture. Shame, on a positive note it is a  good place for cold food and fried perogies though.

This place is so amazing! You have to get Pierogies if you come here and eat the amazing macaroni salad they have! Found this place by accident and was the best thing that ever happened to me! I left this place stuffed and super happy!

This is some of the best ice cream I have ever had the pleasure of eating. The flavors go beyond what you would think possible for ice cream. They’ve got sugar free options and like a thousand different waffle cones. The line is a little wonky, but who cares?! It’s so good you don’t mind being smooshed in between other ice cream lovers. 10/10 would go again

I’ve been going to this ice cream store since I was a little girl, my aunt and older cousins used to take me every time when I cane to visit, now I get to take my younger cousins. Great ice cream! And the whole family loves it!

Loving coming here for a scoop. Great local business. They offer various ice cream, soft serve, take out pints and novelty ice cream too. I love that you can get Sugar babe cupcakes here some weekends too! Just call to see if she's there.

Best ice cream in Bethlehem. All ice cream is made in house, and everything is delicious! The staff works very hard so even when there's a long line, it usually moves very quickly. The owners are amazing project and are always giving back to the community. I would recommend this for everyone, and if you're visiting Bethlehem, a stop at "The Cup" is a must!!
As we all know, the ice-cream and selections here are great... But the price? Just under $20 for 3 cones
OMG best breakfast ever... great food, prices and service in a very cozy ambience... I loved it here!

Passing through Pennsylvania, staying across the street at the Hyatt, they recommend this small little place. Loved it, the small “mom and pop” places are the best. Food was delicious, prices were more than fair, and the lady who took care of us was as sweet as can be! I recommend this place!
The food is always fresh and delicious.  The service is exceptional. Always treated with respect.
The decor left a lot to be desired, but at least the blueberry pancakes had fresh blueberries!
Always a pleasant experience.  Wonderful staff,  excellent food!
Exelente service and good food
Good food.   And     affordable  prices
Great food..I go there about 3 times a week.lol
The Pupusa here so freaking good! My favorite hand down!
Solid spot! papussa are delicious.. My favorite thing is the chicharone with fried yucca..
I grew up eating these cheese steaks and now that I can share it with daughter makes me smile.   Its a great and unique flavor and everyone should try at least one.  Put it on the bucket list.
Good food at a decent price. Very satisfying and simple. No frills which I like. Depends on the person.

As a Philadelphia resident for several years, I have sampled the cheese steaks from those establishments loudly proclaiming themselves king of this culinary specialty.

They are all not only mediocre and overpriced, but exceptionally rude.

In addition, none of their offerings came close to the cheese steaks in an unprepossessing Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, storefront on West Broad Street...

..and now recreated on East Third Street.

The steaks are their splendid selves and, even better, the onion rings are far better -- nice and oily, rather than dessicated by some hot-air cooker.

There now is a far wider menu, and far more welcoming hosts. Returning Lehigh students should find this a haven.

This place is amazing! Great food, amazing service and an atmosphere that is very welcoming and makes you feel at home. They have a great selection of sandwich meats, better than your average boarshead. The chef here really knows what he is doing. The cheese steaks in my opinion are better than anywhere in Bethlehem, I would go as far to say better than Pats and Genos. 10/10
Great food, great people. Best chicken cheesesteak I've ever had

Love this friendly family run coffee shop! Come for the muffins, stay for the coffee! The home made muffins are seriously amazing, I’m working on trying every variety but it’s a tall task! Nicest employees - always welcoming and so friendly!

Java’s brewing is amazing! They make you feel like family and the food is fresh, delicious, and interesting. My personal favorite lunch is the chicken Lisa panini-which is chicken, spinach, bacon, cheddar cheese, and sliced apple with honey mustard ❤️❤️❤️❤️

The green giant smoothie is a cup of wonderful.
Great food! Good coffee. The owners are very nice as well.
Customer service is really good. Not the best cafe type place I've been too but it's okay. Coffee and muffin was just okay. Nothing to write home about. Worth a try.
Excellent service, food made on the premises by the owner and his staff, kind people and a lovely environment. Please support this local family-run business. I have been going for over 10 years.

The food was only two stars but the service was great. The server was sweet & the ambiance was nice, but I’m absolutely shocked by the high star reviews on the food & the fact that this place calls itself authentic Mexican. 

I am fairly certain that many of the key components of the food are frozen or canned, including the weird vegetable blend added to the rice, most certainly the refried beans, & the enchilada sauce. Now, there’s nothing wrong with that in & of itself, although one might assume a restaurant would specialize in a few key ingredients in house, the way an Italian restaurant might make their own sauce. Even if one were to rely heavily on prepared ingredients, I assume you would at least still add seasonings & spices to jazz it up. Instead, the beans tasted plain & incredibly watery while the enchilada sauce was ketchupy.

Food is top-notch and the staff is very friendly. Huge menu selection and all kinds of neat things you can't get elsewhere. The portion sizes seem to have gotten a bit smaller lately but still worth the prices for sure. By far one of the best Mexican restaurants around!
I like that it's BYOB. I'd say the food was decent. I like that they give you salsa and nacho cheese with the tortilla chips.
I really enjoyed this place. The food was good, and the staff was friendly. Thanks for a great night!
Good food. Good prices. Is A win win.

Always a good deal, lots of choices, tons of food, quick service, reliably good tasting. This is a classic diner, best in Bethlehem. Their Greek food is really delicious. I always take home half of my meal. This is also a great breakfast place.

Oh, my stars! The cutest diner with fresh & delicious American & Greek breakfast & lunch! I barely snapped a pic of my scrambled eggs, bacon, & home fried potatoes before diving in. Such a friendly & clean place that it felt like we were in a friend's kitchen.

For what it is it is perfection. You have to get the Greek specials when they have them the lemon soup, the mousaka, the grape leaves yummy
  This is a small breakfast and lunch  counter - with a few tables.  When I lived in the neighborhood I bet I ate there 5 meals a week.

Excellent place for breakfast. 
Food is always good and made the way you order it i recommend it highly

The food is absolutely delicious!! Went in and ordered their cheese steak, it was easily the best sandwich I've had in months! The steak was juicy and the cheese was just the right amount of gooey and savory. Can't wait to go back!! Wish I could have one every day😁

Tiny place but some of the best hot dogs around. They steam the buns which makes them so soft. The "everything" is great, their chili sauce is perfect. Don't forget to get a chocolate milk, seems to be "the thing" in the area.
Quick in and out no frills hotdog joint. Been doing their thing for decades. I usually make a detour for a couple chili dogs if im driving by.
Always good here- if you are ordering a lot I suggest calling ahead.
L my whole family loves there hot dogs. And the one on stefko Blvd. 8s great service if you see Maria tell Judi says hi.
Best hot dogs in the world. I need help now. Thanks to potts doggie shop i have to attend H.A meetings (hot dog anonymous) 👍
SEAFOOD SPRING ROLLS ARE GREAT,  DRUNKEN NOODLES W SHRIMP THE BEST & RICE VERMICELLI. W SHRIMP DELICIOUS. GREAT PLACE FRIENDLY STAFF CLEAN REASONABLY PRICED.

Haven't eaten here but I NEVER will and here’s why. They sent someone around to my apartment complex to put menus on residents doors (which I don’t think is even allowed here). Instead of placing the TWO separate menus with multiple pages inside by everyone’s doors they simply placed them outside of each building on the GROUND. When I got home all of the paper was blown around by the wind in the parking lots and streets of my complex. Who does that??? Really. So lazy and disrespectful. I picked up as many as I could and threw them in the recycle. Tasty China you won’t get any of my business and I won’t recommend you to anyone I know.

Food is alright plus high pricing pass what really gave me a bad taste is the lady that works there serious atti(rude) problem combative dont do it!  I found dragan palace on airport road fast cheap and very good
I called them to diliver some food and they gave me a hard time because 2.2 miles was to far away and the guy that answered the phone was very on professional with a customer
Decent Chinese food, good prices
Informal, good coffee drinks, simple selection of googies to go with coffee...thinks its odd witht he kenyan restaurant in the back but its a good place to hang

Easily the best cakes I've had in my life (I wouldn't call myself a fan of cake so that's saying something). Also has the best vegan soft serve and cheesecake I've ever had. I live an hour away and still get there when I can find the time. Absolutely worth it.

It kills me write this review...but it’s time. I’ve been here 4 times now because I’m vegan, and love supporting vegan businesses. Also their desserts are adorable!! However....the flavors aren’t there.

Most recently got a chocolate raspberry cake thing for Valentine’s Day and literally it just was like super sweet pink icing inside. Just tasted like generic chocolate cake and this overly sweet/grocery store bakery tasting icing. I’m let down every time and it’s so frustrating because I really want to like this place.

I will say though that their soft serve game is on point. Flavors explode in their soft serve!! Please figure out how to translate that to your other treats!!

My wife is allergic to dairy, but loves desserts so we frequent here. Unfortunately they are a monopoly and completely take advantage of that by charging outrageous prices. Their desserts are very good, but their staff leaves a lot to be desired and it would be nice if they didn't hammer people that just want to enjoy something sweet that they can safely eat.

Soft serve is excellent, sometimes the counter staff make it way too small and skinny but this is an adequate portion for $4.50. Plenty of great vegan options in terms of sweets. The Boston cream donuts and chkn and waffle donuts are by far my favorite.

Simply the best! If you don't know, do yourself a favor and check it out. 

Pro tip: If your partner is vegan, splurge on their Valentine's Day boxes. So worth it.

Great Beer, service and atmosphere. Food came out quickly for a large group. The homemade fries should have been hotter (temperature). Everything else was great. The place was very clean. Go place to hang out for a while.

Large party definitely not a good idea. Only good food anyone received was fries. Everything but 2 orders out of 17 went back. Some twice. Bills were all wrong. Even got charged for food never ordered at table. Horrible experience. Extremely disappointed in food.

Come for the beer, not the food. I really want to like this place more but it always falls short on the food. It's great for a few beers however if you're looking for a great meal I would suggest other local places just steps away. If I could give 2 different ratings I would. 5 stars for the beer, 1.5 stars for the food. Sometimes you can't have your cake and eat it too.

wonderful service!! Bartenders do try to remember your order week to week!! Pool tables, lots of lounging areas!! Outstanding food!! Our usual is Wednesday night for steel trap trivia and pool!! Great fun!!
Solid beer selection of site brewed and broader brewery choices.  Huge menu with options for everyone.  Table loved the burgers.  Solid choice in downtown Bethlehem.

Asked for GF french toast. Sometimes they're out. Today, they had it! Great atmosphere. Beautiful paintings. Good music. A bit pricey but worth it. We sat near kitchen so not especially quiet. Recommend closer to the window.
Great restaurant. It has a great menu with American classics and European dishes. Staff was very nice and helpful. Food tastes great and very well presented.

Stopped in with a party of 4.  Based on the menu and prices the place was taking advantage of the influx of quality eats and progessive establishments assisting in the revitalization efforts in the area.  Unfortunately it it fell a little short.  I will pay over 10 for French toast if it is unique and a step above.  Taste was ok but presentation was lazy.  Service was no different that any diner in the area.  I suggest a little better service that a 30+ year experienced waitress going through the motions.
Great service and good food.  A little more expensive than some of the other breakfast places around but made up in quality.  Try the Blintzes.
Phenomenal food and amazing staff and owners! Super cute area too!
This is a hidden gem of south Bethlehem! Delicious, authentic Middle Eastern cuisine in a cozy atmosphere.  Definitely worth visiting on a regular basis!

We were delighted to find this gem of a Middle Eastern restaurant so close to the Lehigh campus.  We enjoyed excellent authentic appetizers and entrees that we all shared and enjoyed!  Atmosphere was cozy and inviting, service was great, and the owner’s family offered us their table as we didn’t have a reservation on a Saturday night.  We left feeling like we had enjoyed a meal prepared by one of my Syrian aunties!  We look forward to future visits!
Had the meat pies, Shawarma with lamb and baklava. Enjoyed the flavors of all three courses.

Possibly the best middle eastern restaurant in the valley, and I've been to almost all of them! If you can, go on a Friday or Saturday for dinner and try their fish special. The housemade sauce on it is super tasty. Overall, food is super good and super cheap.
Wonderful food and even better service

Service was awesome! Server was always super attentive even for refill my water. And give me tips about sauces and what to mix with them.

The food was so fresh! I really enjoyed everything overall. I went for the Restaurant week and they have a special menu with nice prices. Other than a full menu experience is a highly cost.

The only downside for me, I don't eat anything spicy. I always explained that and request nothing spicy on my dishes. I have a limited tasted for spiciness that I can handle. Nothing in my order was supposedly spicy but the sausage was. Worst part is that the sausage was the first thing I tried and after that all my broth was contaminated with the flavor. So all the rest of the items tasted similar to the sausage.

For me, sausage (separating if it's or not spicy) it's not the best option to cook on broth and I think they should know better. 

Neither the pasta nor the vegetables balls were my favorite.

Interesting concept. Great service all around. Quality of proteins was very good. My only complaint if I have one is with four people it is difficult to cook enough at once on the small grill pan on the table. Which translated into quite a long dinner.

Always have a good experience going to Melting Pots. The staff have always been very nice, helpful and friendly. The food is phenomenal, nothing like it anywhere else. It can be expensive and they could have a few more drink options, but overall it's a great place for high end dining.

The new menu items were fantastic. Melting pot continues to push the envelope and redefine what it means to be an amazing restaurant, let alone one that serves fondue. The staff was extremely professional, provided excellent recommendations and were incredibly attentive. I would definitely come here again.

Today I visited for the first time and was delighted with the service. My friend came from Puerto Rico and I mentioned it to our server and she came with a plate decorated in chocolate letters saying Welcome to Bethlehem and the Puertorican flag. That was so awesome and great customer service. The fondue was good and the ambiance.  We had a great first time, totally recommend it.

Food here was excellent but if you're looking for quality customer service while you're enjoying time with friends, this is not the place. Our server was very rude and inattentive. If I ever go back it will be for the quality Indian or I'll just do takeout.
Consistently wonderful food, and excellent service. Have been eating at Nawab for 15 years now, and have yet to find a better Indian restaurant in any location.

Great-value lunch buffet, only $9.95. Unusually for an Indian bufget, unlimited Indian spice tea is included in the buffet, a great plus. Buffet is on the small side, though food itself is excellent. Usually they have only one vegan entree in the buffet, it would be great if they had two.
I love this place! Great authentic food. Dine in or take out try it out you will not be disappointed

Undoubtedly one of the best Indian restaurants in USA. We happened to just go there on our way back home to Harrisburg from New York and oh God! Glad we stopped at Nawab Indian Restaurant, thanks to my wife! Awesome food, great service, good price! I highly recommend this place to all!!
This place has a pretty good vibe. None of the food options really stand out, but the food was still very good. The bread sticks are amazing!

My new fave, food a d drinks on point, nice variety for Happy Hour, nice R n B music playing..make reservations if possible. Our wait was gonna be 40 min, but we put together seats at the bar. Shrimp n flounder was delish
The food was A1 and our waitress was excellent (Nia). She was real cool and deserves a raise. The management was nice and help us. I recommended this place 100%

Service has declined no wait staff it was not very busy I had to ask my server for water and bread which should have been asked after we were seated.  Wait time for our orders were over 40 minutes just for a Salad. Very poor Service. Management should address this if they are not too busy.

Went for a gender reveal they chartering u 250 for a table to share the room with someone else party. How and why tho. 2 parties how fun! And nobody can enjoy due to space,set up,and talking. They were loud playing games. We were trying to tell what the baby was. Just alot. Not we organized thought out correctly. Just want that money. And one of the guest from the other party ate some out food that they laid out for us. Just rude and nasty. I blame the old lady for doing it and starters for the set up.

Absolutely delicious! Going here was a local recommendation (I’m from NY) and wow was I happy we made it happen. Amazing appetizers, entrees, and desserts. I had the Mega cream pie! We’ll definitely be back. Oh and did I mention the people working was amazing 😉 too. Almost family like environment. Perfect 5 stars 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
Thanks Apollo

Apollo never disappoints. Their service is great. They take care of you from your first step into the restaurant. They always have specials on the menu to keep you interested. Their drinks are great and they have seasonal drinks as well. Food is great, drinks are great, atmosphere is great. Highly recommend.

My friends wanted to eat at Corked and I didn’t want to. But I gave in and once again we had a poor experience but Apollo saved our night out!  After we walked out of Corked we came here and had a great night at the bar and enjoyed a few apps.  Apollo doesn’t pretend to be something, it IS something.  Thank you for being consistent!

Apollo Grill is my absolute favorite place to eat in the Lehigh Valley.  It is always my go to place and most highly recommended.  I have been there for brunch, lunch and dinner.  The food is always perfect!  I have never had anything that wasn't AMAZING.  I highly recommend Apollo.  NOTE:  Always try to make a reservation!  :)
First time there and I had a wonderful experience.  Its lobster week so i came to enjoy the 3 course prix fixed menu for $28. Reservations is strongly recommended

Nice large casino floor with a lot of games to play and a lot of slot machines. The floor is level and easy to navigate. There is a good court right outside the casino floor and a few places that you can access from the casino. There is a poker room here. There are outlets upstairs and downstairs here as well and kid's quest is where you can check in your children to play while you go to the casino which is nice. The only issue I saw was that there are a lot of people that come over on buses that sleep at the slot machines and when they are not sleeping they are bumping into you or blocking the walkways because they don't pay attention to where they are going.

It was easy to fine and beautiful scenic drive! I gave it ⭐⭐⭐ because people still smoke on non smoking area, being a non smoker I only gamble on non smoking area. And they don't have free soda machine like Horseshoe & Hollywood.

Really large casino with music on the weekends and all you can eat lobster some nights as well. It took me a while to realize those glowing orange “carrots” hanging from the ceiling are drippings of steel. 

Worth a visit, and maybe the highlight of Bethlehem, PA. It certainly was my highlight since I won quite a bit!

Good luck!

I love the Sands, it is clean, staff is polite and very helpful, we were treated with care and even had an upgrade on rooms for my Birthday to Presidents suit, it was sweet. Love the casino we win all the time it is worth going a distant to get there. Great experience.

It was a nice experience! To Smokey for me because I don't smoke but I accompanied a friend and had a nice time! I love the chairs in the high-roller room! If you ever want to sell them I'm down for 2 and if you really want to be generous Take 6! LOL! Nice time!

The place looks nice.  Prices are too high for quality of food I received. But I guess you pay for the experience more than anything else. I expected the food to wow me and it didn't.  The restaurant Gallagher in NYC was a better overall experience.

The octopus appetizer was delicious! We had the steak with a lobster tail and cream of spinach.  All of the food was excellent and came out quickly.  I highly recommend this place for steaks, sides and atmosphere.

My girlfriend and i both enjoyed steaks and lobster tails that were out of this world. Friendly staff, sat down almost immediately, table service was excellent. Food was pricey but we thoroughly enjoyed.

I visit this place twice monthly.  I try to always sit at the Chef's Bar. This amazing chef named Eric or Derrick (Bad with names) is there almost every time I come. He's amazing!!! EVERY TIME! He's consistent and hard working. He never sits around and is always doing something during the slow time. Cleaning, sharpening, refilling, etc. I watch as he interacts with customers and he's very welcoming...as well as the head Chef!!! I'll continue to support Emeril's Chop House as long as these two are here. This place is great for any occasion! My order is always great!

Emeril's Chop House at the Sands in PA was awesome! Food was outstanding as was the wait staff. We timed it perfectly by being there early; 4:30-ish. We had fab drinks for starters and the dinner was nothing short if amazing. Emeril's notoriety is well warranted. I give the experience 5 stars.

I'm a huge seafood person. So when I discovered the Starfish several years ago, I was excited to see such an extensive menu of fish, fish, and more fish plus, they switch it up weekly so there's always something new.

The best dish I've had here is the Cobia. The texture was completely different (in a good way) from the most of the local seafood that I'm used to having and the seasoning was spot on.

The Three Course Prix Fixe is an amazing deal for what you get and don't miss the crab cake, its easily the best in the valley.
This place is closed.

Great Beer, service and atmosphere. Food came out quickly for a large group. The homemade fries should have been hotter (temperature). Everything else was great. The place was very clean. Go place to hang out for a while.

Large party definitely not a good idea. Only good food anyone received was fries. Everything but 2 orders out of 17 went back. Some twice. Bills were all wrong. Even got charged for food never ordered at table. Horrible experience. Extremely disappointed in food.

Come for the beer, not the food. I really want to like this place more but it always falls short on the food. It's great for a few beers however if you're looking for a great meal I would suggest other local places just steps away. If I could give 2 different ratings I would. 5 stars for the beer, 1.5 stars for the food. Sometimes you can't have your cake and eat it too.

wonderful service!! Bartenders do try to remember your order week to week!! Pool tables, lots of lounging areas!! Outstanding food!! Our usual is Wednesday night for steel trap trivia and pool!! Great fun!!
Solid beer selection of site brewed and broader brewery choices.  Huge menu with options for everyone.  Table loved the burgers.  Solid choice in downtown Bethlehem.
